intro: Assonia longipes, commonly known as the long-footed assonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, attracting various pollinators. Assonia longipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
